website_summaries.verdict: A good family-sized tent that includes a screen porch.
pros: Screened area gives you a place to take off your shoes or sit and not be bothered by bugs
Nice amount of space for up to six people
cons: The rain flap does not completely cover the screened porch area

customer_reviews.title: Coleman Evanston tent put the to test --- and stays dry!
customer_reviews.text: Just camped out in Pocomoke River State Park, Maryland while Hurricane Matthew was battering North Carolina. Our camp site was filled with inches of water, wind was 20-30mph, rain coming from all directions and we were under a flash flood watch. The only thing dry was the inside of my Coleman Evanston tent. Bone dry. Thank you Coleman. Attached picture is take the day after the storm.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L Hammel

customer_reviews.title: Tent poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited when I purchased this tent. I thought it outstanded most of the tents I looked at. Unfortunately, it didn’t last 1 camping trip. The pole to the rain fly broke within the first use and after only 2 camping trips, the top of the tent started ripping. We had absolutely no bad weather and put the tent up carefully. It is made with cheap material. I wish they sold replacement parts, I might just have to look into a new brand for a new tent.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: So dissapointed =(
customer_reviews.text: We were pretty happy with the looks and easy set up of this tent. I had read plenty of reviews and was patting my own back after we set it up on top of a heavy duty tarp and laid out our stuff inside. Sadly, there was rain that night and plenty of water filtered through. Enough to dampen several of our things. If I could return this I would, unfortunately it is too late for that. I bought the 6 person version, If you are considering to purchase a tent that will withstand rain, stay away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: NatalydelCielo

customer_reviews.title: Brand new and broken
customer_reviews.text: Brand new it came with two broken zippers. The front screen zippers were broken in the same place on both sides. I bought it a few months ago and this is the first use. Totally bummed it came broken.
customer_reviews.author: Oceanmyocean

customer_reviews.title: Not cool
customer_reviews.text: Got this tent straight out of the box set it up and one of the poles broke before I could even put it up! Not cool
customer_reviews.author: tali e

customer_reviews.title: The only major downside to this tent (which I didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: The only major downside to this tent (which I didn't notice before buying) is that the back is a screen that can not be closed. There is also a screen at the top of the tent as well. The rain cover provides privacy from people looking in, but not much defense against the cold nights. Needless to say we will have to be WAY more prepared in the future to prevent freezing!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Nice big tent
customer_reviews.text: Nice big tent! Could fit 2 Queen sized inflatable beds in it. Fit my 2 friends and I quite comfortable, could have fit 4 and lots of gear inside. Love the porch area. Could fit 3 chairs there and a cooler. No more bugs!
customer_reviews.author: meowsrus

customer_reviews.title: Coleman doesn’t make them like they used to
customer_reviews.text: Something happened at Coleman a few years ago and their quality went to heck. I have had the 6 person Evanston for years and loved it for its size and enclosed front porch. The rain pooling on the porch was an annoyance but having the porch meant bugs never got into the tent. After many years a zipper went so I bought a new one. If felt cheaper coming out of the box and of course failed on the first night I used it. A seam tore in one spot and one of the pole loops came completed off, irrevocably collapsing a quarter of the tent. The bottom line is you can’t trust this tent.
customer_reviews.author: By the Beach

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, but watch out for pole sleeve defect
customer_reviews.text: We are not happy campers! We have owned other Coleman tents (past and present), and we have never had problems. Unfortunately, after our first camping trip (only two nights), one of the pole sleeves had a 10 inch tear in it. This was NOT a result of a tent pole snagging the pole sleeve. We put up the tent without any issues, and but when we took it down, we noticed the tear/rip before removing the poles (see photo). The product description is true - the pole sleeves are great, but we are not pleased with this defect after our first camping trip with this specific tent.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W Beeson II

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an oversized glamping tent for me and my sister to go car camping. This tent is way too heavy for backpacking. Super easy setup! Love the little entryway... helps keep everything clean. Entryway is big enough for 2 people to hang out in with chairs. Sleeping area is SUPER roomy... My sis ended up using a giant full sized blow up matress and we still had enough room to fit 2 more people. We didn't use it in bad weather but it seems like its super sturdy... and condensation was a non-issue. Love it... recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: The tent entrance is also pretty small compared to other tents in similar size I've ...
customer_reviews.text: It advertises that it fits 2 queen airbeds, but not really, not without them pushing out the side of tent. The tent entrance is also pretty small compared to other tents in similar size I've owned. Too small to put air mattresses through it already inflated, and since portable car powered air pumps dont have 10 ft cords there was no way to blow up our mattresses inside the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Bonita

customer_reviews.title: I like many others set this tent up and the very ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this same make and model in orange for 8 years which I have used many times. I like many others set this tent up and the very first time I set it up the guide for the pole tears. This tent unlike my old one is of very cheap design. I would find another tent.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tent
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, very roomy, easy to setup with one person. I liked the front room as a area to take off shoes or boots. Cabin area is perfect up to 3 people maybe four. Would like to have seen heavier reenforcements in the seams. Over all a great tent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Roe

customer_reviews.title: The entire vestibule does not get covered. Otherwise it is a great tent.
customer_reviews.text: Took this tent on a cross country trip. For the size of the tent it packs up pretty small. I have had other tents with similar construction and they would always have a couple of flaps on the fly that allowed the entire vestibule to be covered. Normally these could be rolled up and tied so they would be out of the way for most of the day. without that it allows water to get into the vestibule so anything you store in there needs to be completely covered on its own if you do not want it to get wet. My cat and dog absolutely love the screened in area.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Stayed Dry - mostly
customer_reviews.text: Have used this tent two times in the past month for two week long Scout Camps. Both times dealt with torrential rain storms. One storm supplied us with 4 inches of rain over two days. Main tent compartment stayed dry but the screen porch area collected water. I used a squeege to clear the collect water out of the porch area. I was able to setup and tear down this tent by myself. Setup took me about 10 minutes and tear down was about the same. Uses three poles and some velcro.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE Customer service - Coleman is UNABLE TO SUPPORT YOU IF THERE'S A PROBLEM!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our new tent arrived with a broken pole (shock cord was broken in the middle). Packaging specifies to call customer service and NOT return item. So we tried calling help line and waited 15 minutes and then got dropped twice. Switched to chat but it wasn't working at first. Finally connected and got dropped 3 times in a chat session at the very start!!! Eventually we think (hope) we were able to create a ticket asking for a replacement on automated system but have no way to confirm because we STILL CANNOT GET THROUGH TO COLEMAN CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! Do yourself a favor and buy a different brand tent because Coleman isn't able to support what they sell
customer_reviews.author: arbrnrngr

customer_reviews.title: Good but one fault.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good family camping tent for MILD weather. It has a vestibule that is perfect for letting your baby or toddler play in, or for getting out of the rain but still being able to watch it, or a mud room......HOWEVER. The ENTIRE rear of the tent is open!!!! It's just netting just like the Windows, but you can't cover it! The only way to cover it is to always put the rain guard on. What a pain. That's my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: john rolfe

customer_reviews.title: Fantatic tent! Must have for camping!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is exceptional. Two people can easily put it up in less than 30 minutes. The first time we used it was on a camping trip out of state. Where we experienced some unusual weather we had multiple hail storms and severe downpours. The tent held up remarkably well it did not tear or leak. I could not say enough good things about this tent I would highly recommend this tent for anyone that's going camping.
customer_reviews.author: mdhenke

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. thunder stormed and did not get water in tent. Porch area we used as mud room and kept bugs out of sleeping area. Very spacious and allowed us room for luggage, twin mattress and queen mattress with walking room left over. Could have easily had two queens, would not have had walking room in the middle, but would have above and/or below mattresses. Easy to stand on as well for me and I am 5”5.
customer_reviews.author: Saundra chavis

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design Makes This a Lemon
customer_reviews.text: If you can keep this standing in a medium wind, you are some sort of wizard. I love the roominess, the porch, and layout, but poor design makes this thing pretty difficult to put up correctly (the poles don’t seem to quite be aligned correctly)—this makes the tension of the poles vs the lines to the stakes a very iffy prospect, causing the poles to flip direction, compromising the integrity of the whole tent at a hint of wind. I may have a lemon, but it seems a good percentage of Coleman products turn out that way lately. I think this will be my last purchase of any of their stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Straight out of box waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This tent did great we camped in unexpected snow showers and freezing temperatures. My issue with the tent is that the screen room really has zero protection from the weather, but I did know that buying the tent. I bought this tent for the sole purpose of camping with my two boys and having more room inside for more comforts like air mattress and my cot. Straight out the box I didn't spray any waterproofing on it for this trip and it was dry inside the tent except for the screen room. I do recommend this tent I have a few tents I like Coleman's floors the best even though they are noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S.

customer_reviews.title: We would like to return this colemans product
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this tent for a trip to Colorado. It was set up one time and the fabric ripped in multiple places. Crucial places that hold the poles. This was a huge problem since we were now in the Rocky Mountains in the rain with a questionable tent. The tent also leaked rain in all four corners of the tent. The canopy should cover the entire screened in area too. We added a spare tarp and anything under the screen was still sure to get soaked. We would like to return this colemans product. Order date: 6-27-17 Order #: 113-8629041-9229854
customer_reviews.author: Cary Dougan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a quality tent so far. It’s huge and heavy but I knew that going in. It has experienced a severe thunderstorm with downpour for a few hours and it did not leak. I have owned many Coleman tents and they all have been hit and miss with the waterproof abilities. So far this one came through. Only thing is the front entrance of the tent will get soaked if you don’t have a rain fly or tarp for it. But I don’t risk it anymore and use a rain tarp over it now. Little more work but worth the dryness. I would purchase this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Oklahoma Camping Tent
customer_reviews.text: We've have been using this tent here in Oklahoma this summer and I have to say it is awesome! Plenty of room inside for two queen size air mattresses and our gear (8 person tent). You could fit two more twin size air mattresses if you needed to. The screen porch section is pretty cool for storing our chairs and cooler in the evenings. That area will get wet but the living quarters will not (with the rain fly). We've been through 3 Oklahoma thunderstorms so far and have had zero issues with water leaking or the tent collapsing. I must say I am a fan!
customer_reviews.author: KiltedSlinger

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent! We just Wish screened in area had cover option for rain.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, we love this tent! We have 3 dogs which is why we purchased this tent haded on other pet owner reviews. My biggest fear was the screened in area if it rained, and we did experience this while camping. The entire screened in area was a huge puddle of water. Trying to figure out a way to tarp or cover this area if rain is expected. Overall though, we loved being able to keep the dogs in this area while we were setting up and cooking dinner. Also great to sit in during night and mornin hours and be free of mosquitos!
customer_reviews.author: vollichick

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The tent was easy to get up by myself. That is important. It held up well in the wind and rain at first.The screened in area was a disaster as previous purchases have said, I tried to cover with a waterproof sheet but that did not work well. After 3 days of relentless rain and wind off Lake Erie I had some water on the floor toward the back of the tent. How it got in I do not know. I broke camp and continued vacation in hotels. The tent may not have a future if I cannot resolve the issues. I think Coleman can create a tent with totally waterproof screened in attached area.
customer_reviews.author: Jill P.

customer_reviews.title: Spaciously comfortable for family of three
customer_reviews.text: Although heavy, this is a great family tent for state park or KOA style camping. For two adults plus a 2 yold, it was perfect. The porch was a perfect potty and clothes changing area for the toddler. We had room inside the dome for the three of us plus our bags. Would not recommend for serious backpacking families - too big and heavy. Would be nice to be able to detach the porch... We loved the bright color which made the inside very inviting. We camped in hot weather and with a small rain shower withOUT the fly and it was great.
customer_reviews.author: Deedot

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly easy to pitch.
customer_reviews.text: We needed a tent for our 7 yo scout camping. Being havent camp myself in a long time.. we hesitant and leaning towards buying a pop up / instant tent. But after reviewing we dicided in giving this particular coleman a try. Upon receiving, we dicided to try pitch it. So me and my 7yo try to pitch tent for the 1st together. Surprisingly, it is easy... both of us took maybe 20 min to pitch it. I highly recommend this tent. Easy to pitch and the inside is big.. very spacious.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent!
customer_reviews.text: We have used it many times river camping and to campgrounds! Sturdy and spacious! The carry case is a little big, but for the size of the tent and the quality you cant beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Good tent at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for the price. I camp on the job for upwards of a week at a time at primitive, at best, locations. Although it is a bit hefty for backpacking it works great as a home base with plenty of room for gear. To compensate for the lack of a back window flap I clipped a mylar emergency blanket to the poles at the rear before attaching the rainfly. My concern was primarily in retaining heat during 35° nights. No complaints as yet.
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: The best tent hands down!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this tent for a couple of years now. I have already made my decision that if something happens to it I will buy another one just like it. We went camping down at a river in NC and it rained so hard you could feel the water rushing underneath the tent. It was scary, if we had not tied it down we probably would have floated off into the river! Not one drop of water ever entered our tent though! Everything we had inside stayed completely dry! The porch on the front is just another bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent
customer_reviews.text: Nice tent, a bit tricky to set up. The fly cover is hard to get on by myself, it takes some maneuvering. I like the porch as it catches the dirt before I enter main camping area. Interior door is small. Trying to get a queen air mattress in is like a snake swallowing a rat. You will need either two twin mattresses or place queen mattress in tent before inflating, though this requires power source to be close to tent. I have not used in inclement weather so I cannot attest to weathering or waterproofing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent.
customer_reviews.text: We really enjoyed this tent on our trip. It had been a very long time since any of us had been camping, but luckily I remember how to put a tent together because my husband was completely lost. haha It's very roomy, we put 1 full and 1 twin air mattress in and had plenty of room between the mattresses and at the front of the tent for our stuff. Had a couple law chairs in the outer room as well. We had rain, a lot of bugs, humidity, and a busted water main uphill and the tent weathered it all perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Drummond

customer_reviews.title: Good Tent with a Major Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and haven't used it yet. Taking off one star right off the bat because, as other reviewers have mentioned, the back of the tent is mesh ONLY. If you look at the pictures, it appears there are two zippered windows and an enclosed back. However, that is definitely not the case. The tent is roomy and tall enough to be able to stand inside. Going camping in a couple of weeks and the temps are supposed to get down into the 40s at night. I'm almost afraid to find out how cold this thing will get inside! Coleman please fix this major flaw! It just doesn't make sense.
customer_reviews.author: Coop816

customer_reviews.title: I liked this tent
customer_reviews.text: I liked this tent. It was easy to put up and take down. I bought this particular model after reading reviews of other similar tents that had little airflow. I thought the screened in entry to help with that on hot summer nights. Unfortunately, the night we used this, it rained. A lot. The tent did fine in the rain, but the "porch part" had rain that came in through the screen. There was no where for the water to drain, so it puddled, making it cumbersome to take down and store. We'll keep using it, and we'll figure a way to rectify that, because we're happy with the rest of the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Terri

customer_reviews.title: We like it!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to set up. I wish there was more privacy w the back window. You’ll only have privacy when the rain cover is on. The strings to anchor the rain cover are kinda dangerous as we kept tripping over them our first time using the tent. Kinda expected w any tent though. Big enough for a queen mattress with about 2ft of space on each size. Screened in section is just big enough for 2 camping chairs and a table. Not much room to move around but it works when bugs come out.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Love the Space
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent so far...i've used 3 times - hadn't had much real rain for a full blown test but so far love this tent....easy to setup and its huge for my needs...love the patio feature wit the mesh nets....really helps for storage and more importantly bug control. Seemed to be very breathable with the rain shield on when setup properly for good ventilation and very little condensation build up from overnights. Always have been a huge fan of Coleman tents....they just work for the budget camper.
customer_reviews.author: David Schumacher

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it!
customer_reviews.text: "Separate screened room offers bug-free lounging" except it's a little TOO separate. On each side of the screened room where it attaches to the tent, there is a two-inch diameter hole at floor level that seems to be a design flaw. We trusted the outside screen, left the door open in the night, and woke up to ants crawling on us! Really annoyed, because everything else was great--easy to put together, spacious, stood up to some rain and wind just fine...but the bug-full lounging is a deal-breaker. Back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: lots of useful features and pockets
customer_reviews.text: the reviews about the back side having no covering are true. this is fixed with the rainfly cover in place. overall though this is a downright luxurious tent, especially considering the price. lots of useful features and pockets, and easy to set up and take down. also, conveniently, a tarp from the hardware store works great as a ground cover--it's nearly a perfect fit and was dirt cheap. great for car camping.
customer_reviews.author: amazonshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for small family!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for a family of four! Plenty of space for us, easy to set up, and quite solid. Haven’t tested it in the rain, but we are happy with it nearly a year later ☺️
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent
customer_reviews.text: Used this for 3 nights in Alaska one of which rained the entire evening into the morning with no leaks in the sleeping portion. I would have rated 5 Star, however the only portion I would change is to better cover the screened seating area with the topper, there was a huge puddle by morning. Very large inside, I am 5’4” and could stand up all the way. We fit a double air mattress and an additional twin mattress with extra room left in the entry. Next time I use the tent I am going to tie a tarp onto trees over the screened area to better protect from weather. Takes two people to set this up easiest as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any 3 season application.
customer_reviews.text: I went camping 5 days in the Rockies late August. It rained heavy for 30 min, then light rain for 2 hours. There where absolutely no leaks. The highest wind I got was about 30 mph gusts with a constant 15 mph constant for 2 hours. Held up fine. The exterior was more than roomy for just me. Loved the vacation. 5 stars, highly recommend this tent for up to 3 campers, can fit 4 well I'm sure. The large rear window could have a removable cover for volder weather, like below 40 F.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Graybast

customer_reviews.title: The front end screened in porch was kind of cool until a heavy rain came and soaked it
customer_reviews.text: The big open screen panel on the back side of the tent doesn't have enough protection from the fly. Cold air came up under the fly and through that screen. I had to cover that area with an extra tarp to stay warm. The front end screened in porch was kind of cool until a heavy rain came and soaked it. Again I had to get an extra tarp to put over it to keep things dry. Three corners on the bottom of the tent seemed sewn together poorly and I had small puddles of water in them after a heavy rain. I am considering returning this tent. I usually like Coleman products but now I'm not so sure.
customer_reviews.author: cyrious

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this for a music festival. The little porch on the front provided shade from the harsh June sun. On Our last night at the festival there was heavy wind and downpour. We were one of the only people who had stayed dry and with everything in tact. Great tent in my book. Easy to set up and plenty of room.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is amazing!!!! Very simple to put together with easy to understand instructions. It's spacious and very comfortable with the screened in porch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Alright tent
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I bought this tent for a weekend camping trip. There was some positives and negatives to it. Some positives: the screen porch is nice, it is a roomy tent, and it stayed dry. Some negatives: there is no electrical hole, my hair kept getting caught in the zipper, the zipper kept getting caught on the fabric making it hard to shut, and the how the step inside and the door are you have to crouch down which can be annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene W

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent - better than the Marmot
customer_reviews.text: After spending $400 on a Marmot that easily ripped and mildewed - this Coleman has been much beloved. Designed with large deep windows, air circulates on hot nights, yet keeps rain out even when torrential. Air circulation is key on this tent. Rain does come into the slanted screened porch. This I don't love. Yet it does allow some covered storage outside the tent, which I do. The price on this tent is amazing...which allows forgiveness on the screen design error. As a family, who loves camping - I highly recommend this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Heatherlouisa

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is everything I was hoping it would be. Very roomy. The rain fly is well thought out. A single shock corded pole and a few cords cinched tight and it covers everywhere it should and all the way down to the corners. Lesser tents provide a rain fly that does not cover much and many times comes in contact with the tent walls. This should not happen with this tent. I’m so happy with this purchase! Coleman always makes the right stuff.
customer_reviews.author: mike jones

customer_reviews.title: A few shortcomings
customer_reviews.text: This tent is definitely NOT a four season tent. The back of the tent is mostly open mesh as are the air vents on top. There is no way to close any of them. It is fairly easy to erect. The screened porch is not a good feature in the event you encounter rain during your camping trip. The rain comes in and puddles on the floor of it so you are constantly tracking water into the interior of your tent. I won’t have to worry about any of these shortcomings anymore because it was destroyed by a violent storm during my camping trip last week.
customer_reviews.author: MissouriDebbie

customer_reviews.title: Overall nice tent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tent overall. We used it over the holiday weekend when it rained for about 30 minutes one day (without issue) and stormed for about an hour, but without any high winds or extremely pounding rain (it has a rather leaky back corner we had to put a towel in). We used all stakes and guy-lines to make a very taunt rain cover but it still got wet. We liked the screened porch, but do wish it would have more water Protection. Again, overall nice tent for car camping, will hold 4 adults decently.
customer_reviews.author: LingLing

customer_reviews.title: Check the weather before using it
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not for windy days and chilling days. A leakage problem in the front porch during rainy days. Only for warm, sunny day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent!
customer_reviews.text: Best Coleman tent EVER! We have drug this thing everywhere from sandy beach camping to snowy Wyoming mountain camping and have LOVED it every minute! Its my husband and I along with 2 sons (2/4) - and it holds us all very well with lots of extra goodies. We even used a fold up picnic table in it once in the rain. It has held up to some major rain and wind and has no holes or damage and does not leak. We are very pleased and would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Meredith S.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Perfect Tent
customer_reviews.text: We survived a monsoon while camping in a low-lying flood zone. We could have been floating at one point, but everything inside our tent was bone dry! Note: I said inside the tent (that does not include the screen porch)! It’s a screen porch, people. It’s meant for experiencing the elements. This tent was super easy to assemble - just me and my 9 year old. I have so much confidence in this tent that we are taking it on a 28 day mother-son camping trip this summer. The only con is I wish it had a “pocket socket” for an extension chord, but we made do just fine... even in a monsoon. It’s a great tent for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No luck setting it up alone yet :-(
customer_reviews.text: I really do think I will like this tent, IF I can set it up alone. I took it out about an hour from home without setting it up at home first because the weather was so hot (mid-Atlantic August). Big mistake because I could not figure out how to get all the poles in the little holders at the same time and raise the middle by myself. It being 100 degrees or so, I almost passed out and went home. I will update this when I try again in October, after figuring out how to do it. I want the solo outdoor time, and my brother is going to help figure out how to do it.
customer_reviews.author: V. Lord

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Gone on a couple camp outs with my daughter with this tent. It’s nice and big. Fits our queen size hair mattress. Has windows and little pockets on the inside to keep things in. It rained pretty hard one of the nights we camped out. It’s water resistant for the most part. The front porch did get wet but wasn’t too surprised about that. Very sturdy tent. Didn’t feel like the wind was going to blow the tent away and that’s always a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: The setup took a while but it is a good tent. I wouldn't use for hardcore camping but so far I've used 4 times this summer with no issues. Colemen sales large tents that are easier to set up so if you don't mind doing this by yourself it will take a little longer. I didn't get to test it out the water resistance but I "suspect" it is not very waterproof. I would purchase a water sealant for some of the seams.
customer_reviews.author: Trash Panda

customer_reviews.title: NO LEAKS! Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Just as promised, no leaks in 2 wind/rain/hailstorms with 20mph winds at 8200 ft in Colorado. Not that quick a set-up: took about 30-40 minutes from bag to done. Get heavier duty stakes than those supplied and a car window squeegee to pull the water over to the floor drain mesh in the screen porch. It will accumulate at the door entrance if you are pitched with the screenroom on the uphill side of the slant. You have to be kinda short to stand in the middle of the tent and forget standing if you have a queensize inflatable mattress in there.
customer_reviews.author: cb

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about this tent so far
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this tent so far. Bought it to do a 1000 mile move with a horse, cat, and rabbit alone in midsummer heat from Norcal to Eastern WA. Broke my foot the first day of the move so was very compromised and yet was still able to set this up in no time flat, alone. The screen room gave the bunny somewhere to be and the main cabin for the kitty. Worked until kitty decided to swing from the ceiling at 2am. Back in the dog kennel. Four stars because out of the four times I have used it, I have only gotten it back in the bag once.
customer_reviews.author: Allysen Brown

customer_reviews.title: Poles will snap in high winds
customer_reviews.text: The poles do not stand up to the wind. After coming back from hiking in Death Valley, the tent was partially collapsed with 2 of the poles completely snapped. No way to repair except buying new poles. Very disappointed with the quality of the poles.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent!
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this tent! It's so easy to set up and I can set it up by myself in less than 20 mins. We tested it out this weekend during a horrible thunderstorm for 2 nights and it kept us safe and dry. My only complaint and why I'm only giving it 4 stars is because there isn't a sleeve for the outlet, but I think it's meant to be like that to keep the tent weather proof. I highly recommend this tent for small families or couples who enjoy the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lena

customer_reviews.title: The best tent for family
customer_reviews.text: I researched different tents and finally decided on this one. It has a lot of space for a couple of beds and our bags.This is a nice, comfortable tent.I love the porch,very convenient.Highly recommended for family five to eight members!
customer_reviews.author: F. Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent, not completely sold on the screen porch.
customer_reviews.text: Bought four of these for a Boy Scout Troop. Been using the Evanston 8 for several years and was initially disappointed when we discovered that Coleman had changed the design. The jury is still out on the screened-in "porch", particularly as the floor is likely to collect water when it rains. The sleeping portion of the tent is also slightly smaller than the prior generation.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Mcdonnell

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!  Needs a few tweeks
customer_reviews.text: The tent is great and took about 15 minutes to assembly the first time. It's very spacious and having the screened-in area is convenient if there are bugs/mosquitoes around. PRO: * Very spacious * Easy to assemble/disassemble * Good construction / seams CON: * Front pole broke during first use (getting a replacement pole is VERY time consuming from Coleman) * If it rains, water will enter the screened-in area (suggest adding a tarp or 12' x 12' canopy in the front) Overall, I'm very happy with the tent and once I get the replacement pole, I'll be back out in the forest!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Schulte

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, super durable
customer_reviews.text: We love this tent! Originally bought so we could throw down an air mattress, (too old for the ground, too cheap for a camper lol) but it has already been put through the ringer this year with high winds, rain and snow on several trips, surviving them all! Super flexible poles helped it withstand 20+ mph winds, the rain fly is perfect for keep moisture out of the tent while still allowing the windowsvto be open for airflow. Love the screened in patio area for the dog also!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, except...
customer_reviews.text: The way the front room is and the rain fly is set back...it offers no protection from rain. But still good tent, if the weather is good.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie V

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: used this tent for 3 days, got rained on, and it held up great! super easy to put up, and comes with everything you need.
customer_reviews.author: Stark the Dane

customer_reviews.title: Nice and big 5-man tent with 3-man bonus room (based on weather)
customer_reviews.text: Nice and big 5-man tent with 3-man bonus room if weather is good. I like how the screened entry area has drains in the corners and along the entry way, so if it rains, it does not fill up. Also note that the main part of the test is built like an individual tent. Walking from the screened area to main tent requires stepping over the door entry (6-8 inches high). This is good because it means you don't have to worry about water/bugs entering from screened area.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Main Tent Pole for Rain Fly String Broke After First Use
customer_reviews.text: Spacious tent, screen room is great for taking off your shoes and storing things you don't want out in the open. It rained on us on your trip and tent held up no water getting (except in front screen room, which is expected). Everything seems Coleman quality EXCEPT the fact that the string in the main rain fly pole broke. If we wanted to use again we would have to tape the pole together. The rain fly will not serve its purpose with out the pole. Super disappointed it only lasted ONE trip...
customer_reviews.author: jacob cook

customer_reviews.title: Great Family of 4 Tent.
customer_reviews.text: I know it is a "6 Person" Tent, but if you want just a hair of room, stick with 4 people. Holds 2 queen size air mattresses. We personally used 1 queen sized mattress and two small self inflatable for the kids. Plenty of room. DO KNOW THIS. The upper portion of the back wall of the tent is mesh, and it cannot be covered/zipped up like the other windows. So this might not be the best tent for the fall/winter. It got a little cool during the night.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Raymer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our family of 3 and 2 dogs
customer_reviews.text: recently went camping with this tent. Assembly and teardown were straightforward and instructions are sewn in so no need having to worry about losing a paper. The front porch area was great to catch a lot of the dirt so the sleeping area was clean. Lots of room for 3 people and 2 dogs to stretch out even with toys for my son. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Terrible tent poles and rain gets inside the vestibule.... otherwise OK
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice big tent, and I like the little vestibule "porch" except when it rains... then it gets absolutely swamped! And the 2nd time I used it, I pulled the tent poles out and the elastic was broken in all of them! And no - I did not put them away wet. So after replacing the pole elastic, last weekend I used the tent again and the pole for the rain tarp was broken. Very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Holly E.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint about this tent is that it states it will fit 2 queen air beds, and it will, but boy is it a tight fit. We took this camping just outside of Yosemite, so we wernt in a position to get a smaller air bed. The 2 queens fit but i am honestly surprised we didnt rip the seams on the tent. So my advice is set it up before hand and make sure your mattresses fit. Other than that the tent is great! Easy to set up, pretty durable, and I love the mosquito net front room. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This tent was way more durable then I expected. It rained the first day we got to our campsite and it rained bad. The inside was completely dry except for the screened in porch of course which had a huge puddle in it. But assembly was easy and we were able to fit a queen and twin and still had enough space to walk around without bending might I add.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey WiIIiams

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent, have used it twice now
customer_reviews.text: Nice tent, have used it twice now. Sets up easy first time was in the dark ( I don't recommend that thought) I am 6'5" tall and can almost stand up in the center. However going through the doors is a pain in the back, literally. In hind site I would not get the one with the screen in front.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M. Lagarde

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, roomy dome tent! As with typical dome tents, it is very simple in design to set up and breakdown, but do to the height, it could be a little bit challenging for us shorter people to get the rainfly on. We've only gotten to use it once last year, but it did hold up to one day of heavy rain. Absolutely love the fully enclosed screen porch room which is my favorite feature of this tent. At around $140 on Amazon, it is a bargain. Our friends with their $500 Eureka tent were quite jealous at how easy it went updown and the price tag
customer_reviews.author: Xraycer

customer_reviews.title: Stayed dry
customer_reviews.text: Took this tent camping on a rainy, windy weekend. It was easy to set up and we stayed dry. The screened area definitely gets water as it’s not covered by the rain flap but the main room of the tent stayed dry. Definitely could not fit two queen air mattresses in this tent. One takes up the majority of the tent. My only other complaint is that the port for electricity was only to the screened area, which mean to get an extension cord inside the tent it has to go thru the zippered door. All in all decent simple tent
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Agattas

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy/use if it is going to rain!
customer_reviews.text: Great Tent, BUT I didn't want to buy more than one tent (one for if its nice out and one for when it might rain). The front "porch/screened in area" is nice but the fills with water when it rains making a small pool in the morning you get to step into before getting out of the tent. This tent should have had a roof that extended away from the tent not slants back toward the tent allowing rain to easily fall into he screened in area.
customer_reviews.author: ladnar

customer_reviews.title: Decent Tent
customer_reviews.text: Over all was happy with this tent. It has a good amount of space inside. Personally I would never try to fit more then 4 people in the tent but that is because I like to have some space. Unfortunately for us it rained on our trip and the front screen area flooded with water so our shoes got soaked. I also forgot to weather proof the seams even though I purchased the stuff for that, and the corner seams only leaked a very tiny bit which wasn't a big deal. The tent was easy to set up and take down. I hope it will last us many more camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: charissa

customer_reviews.title: Lasted through an INSANE storm
customer_reviews.text: This tent was amazing! It fit 4 people with plenty of room to spare, plus, it kept us dry during a crazy storm with a strobe light lightning and an intense downpour with a bit of flooding. Our tent kept us totally dry, while the storm leaked right through my friend's tent next to us. That storm also completely destroyed 2 other tents a few sites down. Ours held up perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Becki

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TENT
customer_reviews.text: What a great tent! The front "porch" is so useful. My 2 year old played in there when the mosquitos were so bad this year and she could see and hear us. Also keeps a much cleaner tent if you keep your shoes outside. Pockets on 3 sides of the tent for small items. The awnings over the windows are nice to keep the sun out in the AM. We have a Queen size air mattress and a cot for my child, all fit in nicely with room to move around. Overall extremely happy with this tent.
customer_reviews.author: ScH

customer_reviews.title: Nice & spacious
customer_reviews.text: Tested out in the backyard last night. It didn't rain & I don't know if there's an updated version, but the rain slip definitely has a lip that goes over the porch... Thinking will stay fairly dry! Also can definitely fit 2 queen air mattresses in there. We had one and could easily fit another. Put it up by myself -no trouble. Can speak of durability, but came with 1 yr warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Mike McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Great tent in small bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent so much I bought two! It goes up easily and the front porch area is high-quality and makes a world of difference when tent camping. One of the few I found that has a nylon floor to the porch area. We have been using these tents for about two years with no issue. Only 4 stars due to the bag it comes in. As with most tense, the bag that holds it could be larger. It’s a big job trying to get it back into the bag every time. I still don’t understand why companies don’t make larger bags.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan A. Dix

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son and I set the tent up in the backyard a week after we received it. There was a 10 mph breeze. One of the poles snapped and splintered, ripping the tent material. The tent is now unusable. Before purchasing this particular tent, I watched several videos about it and other tents. The video for this Coleman tent showed it withstanding a 60 mile an hour winds for 1 hour with rain. I've had better luck with an Ozark Trail tent from Walmart that I purchased 10 years ago. I would save the money and go with a cheaper brand. Coleman does not have the same quality that it used have to several years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: The footprint is quite large but assembly is very easy. Two of us share the tent with each ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used the smaller version of this tent without the screen porch. There was an incident with rocks and wind in Death Valley so I replaced the old one with this one. The footprint is quite large but assembly is very easy. Two of us share the tent with each of us on our own Coleman cot. It is perfect for car camping in the nation parks. There is a tear-away strip on the bottom of the bag to make it bigger so packing it away is not as difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Rain Cover Needed For Porch
customer_reviews.text: So if you look at the picture, the porch is not covered completely by the rain guard. But that’s where 2 additional people are meant to sleep. We were protected in the main tent, but lots of puddles in the porch area. This is tricky as we are practicing with our pets to sleep in the tent for a long move we have. They were getting wet going back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: The best camping choice
customer_reviews.text: Entire family love it, The porch is useful for keeping stuff like chillers or any camping material or shoes/ sandals. Very much spacious test for 6 people, need not to worry about mosquitoes as you can place fire-pit and sit inside enjoy with family entire night talking talking... We had first camping with great experience.... Easy to setup and easy to pack.... over all its very good product... worth it.
customer_reviews.author: RamaKrishna Tadepalli

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tent!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. Very comfortable. Everything you would need for a great tent. I was worried it would be too big but worked out great! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher Barres

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent! It was easy to put up and has tons of space for all of my family. We were able to fit a full queen-sized blow up mattress and two more smaller sleeping bags in line next to each other. There was extra room at the entrance where we put the backpacks and other items we wanted to keep in the tent. it's tall enough for my 6 ft 1 in husband to stand up in the middle. We love having the little "porch" out front to hang out in before going to sleep. It's nice to have a screened in spot free from bugs where we can sit and chat.
customer_reviews.author: teemccue

customer_reviews.title: Love it... especially the porch
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about the tent... took 40 minutes the first time but most of that was figuring out the rainfly! Honestly my biggest complaint is the storage bag is too small to fit it all back in!
customer_reviews.author: MEREDITH L.

customer_reviews.title: Already Ripped
customer_reviews.text: Everything ok so far except for in our initial set up, the material snagged on a pole and immediately ripped a chunk out of the fabric sleeve that holds the pole. Really not a testament to my thinking this will last very long. It isn't ruined by any means but I am definitely treating it like it's a Faberge Egg or else I'm afraid it will damage more. All in all, it's huge, set up was easy, quality and durability a BIG question mark.
customer_reviews.author: ushistoryteach

customer_reviews.title: Descent tent for light camping
customer_reviews.text: I loved the screened in area. The tent was lightweight and easy to put up. It seemed to tear easily. We had a few areas that tore after only one use.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Car Camping.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent for FOUR adults. The screened- in porch is not covered so if it rains, you things will get wet unless you move them inside the tent. Easy set up once you know what you're doing. I suggest watching a Youtube video before your first set up. The bag it comes in is small, I bought a bin to put it in after.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roomy. Guaranteed to keep you dry
customer_reviews.text: Zippers do not hang up. Nice n smooth. 2 inner flaps to hold small items.. (cellphone). Stayed together even in stiff wind.. RECOMMENDED. WOULD BUY AGAIN
customer_reviews.author: CRAIG ANDERSON

customer_reviews.title: Its a good size but I expected it to be a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: Its a good size but I expected it to be a bit higher. I am really surprised at how much water can get into the screened area when it rains. I am going to need to start putting up a tarp over that area for sure. You have more than enough area for two queen mattresses. I really wish they would make it 4 inches higher, offer an optional extension for the screened vestibule to keep water out and put a darn zip cover on the back screen (didn't sound like a big deal at first but it really dampens the privacy). Dealing with that with a small WalMart tarp and some clothes pins.
customer_reviews.author: JD Winty

customer_reviews.title: Needs better stakes
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new tent last minute so we ordered this one. Did get rained on but no water leaked in, other then the front access that has the net covering but inside the actually tent stayed dry. Only issue would be the little stakes that come with it. Got some moderate wind and they popped right out of the ground. Would definitely recommend picking up some more sturdy ones. We were able to get some and since that have had no issues
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Porch is a nice bonus
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter-in-law as a birthday gift. They set it up in the backyard as a test and love it. My son says it’s roomy enough for them and my 2 grandchildren. They especially like the porch feature. They said setup was not difficult. A good deal for a tent in this price range. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Aviva Gittle Publishing

customer_reviews.title: Have used a few times and LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: Just booked another camping trip and will be bringing this tent again. The only think they didn't include was a power cord hole (so we just run it through the zipper of the door. I expect many years with this. Add a carpet/rug to the patio portion, to keep dirt and sand out of the main tent. You can thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: sg5432

customer_reviews.title: Roomy, but not a simple set-up.
customer_reviews.text: It's roomy, but it's a pain to set up. I have done it single-handed, but I recommend having help. There is ample space for two adults along with bags and such. It has two interior pockets (on opposite sides) for keys and such. I noticed that some tents have only one pocket, so that was a factor in my choice to not buy a different tent. After using this, I'm not so much a fan of the gazebo/screen porch. I thought I would like it, but now I wish I had opted for a simpler non-gazebo design. The rain-fly has 7 guy-wire-strings (trip-hazards) when fully set-up, and I think most are due to the gazebo feature.
customer_reviews.author: isosaf

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tent and here is a carrying case for it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product Excellent Value. There must be Chinese tent folding fairies that put this in it's factory carrying case which is nice because, we mere mortals will never get it back inside! After cleaning, drying, etc....we folded it up and measured it. Off to Harbor Freight for some 2inch wide Velcro strips three feet long, score. We ordered an Outdoor Products, XL Mountain Duffle (15.6inx17.6inx35.1in) to store it in, works perfectly. Holds: Tent; Rain Fly; Poles; Stakes (and beefmaster after market tent stakes, highly recommended), and a 12ftx12ft, Harbor Freight ground cover to boot! Carrier Bag:  After Market Tent Stakes:
customer_reviews.author: 7SFCW4

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: I loved the tent the first two times we took it. We just got back from our third use and the seams are splitting in 2 places. It rained while we were camping the the from screened porch had puddles of water in it, which you had to step thru to get to the inner part of the tent. It was a mes. Mud and water and horrible. It was super wind luckily we bought better stakes which kept the tent in place. Am really bummed and hoping we will be able to exchange for something different.
customer_reviews.author: T

product_meta.title: Coleman Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
product_meta.description: Enjoy the great outdoors without the bugs inside the Coleman Evanston 8-Person Tent with Screen Room. Great for car camping and extended camping trips, this spacious tent offers enough room for 2 queen-size airbeds and is designed to set up in under 15 minutes thanks to snag-free, continuous pole sleeves and Insta-Clip pole attachments. The tent’s WeatherTec system features patented welded floors and inverted seams to keep the rain off you and your gear; a rainfly is included for extra weather protection. Extended awnings let you keep the windows open for enhanced air circulation without letting in the rain. The tent also comes with a separate screened-in room for extra ventilation, covered storage for your gear, or an extra sleeping area on warmer, dry nights. Remove the included rainfly to let in more sunlight through the mesh roof on dry days or to gaze up at the stars on dry nights. "
feature_bullets: Weatherproof: Welded corners and inverted seams keep water from getting in; included rainfly offers extra weather protection
Conventional pitch: Sets up in 15 minutes
Bug-free lounging: 10 x 5 ft. Full-floor screen room
Roomy interior: 10 x 9 ft. With 5 ft. 8 in. Center height; fits 2 queen-size air beds
Carry bag: Included for easy storage

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
